blocks.name: class2set
blocks.content: Construct, from any class ` A ` , a set equal to it when the class exists and equal to the empty set when the class is proper. This theorem shows that the constructed set always exists. (Contributed by NM, 16-Oct-2003.)
blocks.origin:
thm class2set(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wcel(crab(s0, c0, wcel(c0, universe)), universe)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  pm2.61i(wcel(crab(s0, c0, wcel(c0, universe)), universe), wcel(c0, universe))
  rabexg(s0, c0, universe, wcel(c0, universe))
  syl6eqel(crab(s0, c0, wcel(c0, universe)), universe, emptycls, wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  sylib(wn(wcel(c0, universe)), wceq(crab(s0, c0, wcel(c0, universe)), emptycls), wn(wrex(s0, c0, wcel(c0, universe))))
  nrexdv(s0, c0, wn(wcel(c0, universe)), wcel(c0, universe))
  simpl(wn(wcel(c0, universe)), wcel(cv(s0), c0))
  necon1bbii(crab(s0, c0, wcel(c0, universe)), emptycls, wrex(s0, c0, wcel(c0, universe)))
  rabn0(s0, c0, wcel(c0, universe))
  0ex()
  diff.wn.s(s0, wcel(c0, universe))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, universe)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm class2set(setvar s0, class c0) {
  ⊢ { s0 ∈ c0 | c0 ∈ 𝕌 } ∈ 𝕌
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  pm2.61i({ s0 ∈ c0 | c0 ∈ 𝕌 } ∈ 𝕌, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  rabexg(s0, c0, universe, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  syl6eqel({ s0 ∈ c0 | c0 ∈ 𝕌 }, universe, emptycls, ¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  sylib(¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌, { s0 ∈ c0 | c0 ∈ 𝕌 } = ∅, ¬ ∃(s0 ∈ c0, c0 ∈ 𝕌))
  nrexdv(s0, c0, ¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  simpl(¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌, s0 ∈ c0)
  necon1bbii({ s0 ∈ c0 | c0 ∈ 𝕌 }, emptycls, ∃(s0 ∈ c0, c0 ∈ 𝕌))
  rabn0(s0, c0, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  0ex()
  diff.wn.s(s0, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, universe)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: class2seteq
blocks.content: Equality theorem based on ~ class2set . (Contributed by NM, 13-Dec-2005.) (Proof shortened by Raph Levien, 30-Jun-2006.)
blocks.origin:
thm class2seteq(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(crab(s0, c0, wcel(c0, universe)), c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  syl(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(crab(s0, c0, wcel(c0, universe)), c0), wcel(c0, universe))
  elex(c0, c1)
  eqcomd(crab(s0, c0, wcel(c0, universe)), c0, wcel(c0, universe))
  sylibr(wcel(c0, universe), wceq(c0, crab(s0, c0, wcel(c0, universe))), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c0, universe)))
  ralrimiv(s0, c0, wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c0, universe))
  ax-1(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(cv(s0), c0))
  rabid2(s0, c0, wcel(c0, universe))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, universe)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm class2seteq(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 → { s0 ∈ c0 | c0 ∈ 𝕌 } = c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  syl(c0 ∈ c1, { s0 ∈ c0 | c0 ∈ 𝕌 } = c0, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  elex(c0, c1)
  eqcomd({ s0 ∈ c0 | c0 ∈ 𝕌 }, c0, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  sylibr(c0 ∈ 𝕌, c0 = { s0 ∈ c0 | c0 ∈ 𝕌 }, ∀(s0 ∈ c0, c0 ∈ 𝕌))
  ralrimiv(s0, c0, c0 ∈ 𝕌, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  ax-1(c0 ∈ 𝕌, s0 ∈ c0)
  rabid2(s0, c0, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, universe)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: 0elpw
blocks.content: Every power class contains the empty set. (Contributed by NM, 25-Oct-2007.)

blocks.name: pwne0
blocks.content: A power class is never empty. (Contributed by NM, 3-Sep-2018.)

blocks.name: 0nep0
blocks.content: The empty set and its power set are not equal. (Contributed by NM, 23-Dec-1993.)

blocks.name: 0inp0
blocks.content: Something cannot be equal to both the null set and the power set of the null set. (Contributed by NM, 21-Jun-1993.)

blocks.name: unidif0
blocks.content: The removal of the empty set from a class does not affect its union. (Contributed by NM, 22-Mar-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm unidif0(class c0) {
  |- wceq(cuni(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))), cuni(c0))
} = {
  3eqtri(cuni(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))), cuni(c0), cun(emptycls, cuni(c0)), cun(cuni(c0), emptycls))
  3eqtri(cuni(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))), cun(emptycls, cuni(c0)), cuni(cun(csn(emptycls), c0)), cun(cuni(csn(emptycls)), cuni(c0)))
  3eqtr4ri(cuni(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))), cuni(cun(csn(emptycls), c0)), cuni(cun(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls)), csn(emptycls))), cun(cuni(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))), cuni(csn(emptycls))))
  uniun(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls)), csn(emptycls))
  unieqi(cun(csn(emptycls), c0), cun(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls)), csn(emptycls)))
  eqtr2i(cun(csn(emptycls), c0), cun(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls)), csn(emptycls)), cun(c0, csn(emptycls)))
  undif1(c0, csn(emptycls))
  uncom(c0, csn(emptycls))
  eqtr2i(cuni(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))), cun(cuni(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))), cuni(csn(emptycls))), cun(cuni(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))), emptycls))
  uneq2i(cuni(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))), cuni(csn(emptycls)), emptycls)
  un0(cuni(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))))
  uniun(csn(emptycls), c0)
  uneq1i(cuni(csn(emptycls)), cuni(c0), emptycls)
  unisn(emptycls)
  0ex()
  uncom(emptycls, cuni(c0))
  un0(cuni(c0))
}

blocks.name: iin0
blocks.content: An indexed intersection of the empty set, with a nonempty index set, is empty. (Contributed by NM, 20-Oct-2005.)
blocks.origin:
thm iin0(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wb(wne(c0, emptycls), wceq(ciin(s0, c0, emptycls), emptycls))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  impbii(wne(c0, emptycls), wceq(ciin(s0, c0, emptycls), emptycls))
  iinconst(s0, c0, emptycls)
  necon2ai(c0, emptycls, wceq(ciin(s0, c0, emptycls), emptycls))
  mtbiri(wceq(c0, emptycls), wceq(ciin(s0, c0, emptycls), emptycls), wceq(ciin(s0, emptycls, emptycls), emptycls))
  mtbir(wceq(ciin(s0, emptycls, emptycls), emptycls), wceq(universe, emptycls))
  n0ii(universe, emptycls)
  0ex()
  eqeq1i(ciin(s0, emptycls, emptycls), emptycls, universe)
  0iin(s0, emptycls)
  eqeq1d(ciin(s0, c0, emptycls), emptycls, ciin(s0, emptycls, emptycls), wceq(c0, emptycls))
  iineq1(s0, c0, emptycls, emptycls)
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm iin0(setvar s0, class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ≠ ∅ ↔ ⋂(s0 ∈ c0, ∅)= ∅)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  impbii(c0 ≠ ∅, ⋂(s0 ∈ c0, ∅)= ∅)
  iinconst(s0, c0, emptycls)
  necon2ai(c0, emptycls, ⋂(s0 ∈ c0, ∅)= ∅)
  mtbiri(c0 = ∅, ⋂(s0 ∈ c0, ∅)= ∅, ⋂(s0 ∈ ∅, ∅)= ∅)
  mtbir(⋂(s0 ∈ ∅, ∅)= ∅, 𝕌 = ∅)
  n0ii(universe, emptycls)
  0ex()
  eqeq1i(⋂(s0 ∈ ∅, ∅), emptycls, universe)
  0iin(s0, emptycls)
  eqeq1d(⋂(s0 ∈ c0, ∅), emptycls, ⋂(s0 ∈ ∅, ∅), c0 = ∅)
  iineq1(s0, c0, emptycls, emptycls)
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: notzfaus
blocks.content: In the Separation Scheme ~ zfauscl , we require that ` y ` not occur in ` ph ` (which can be generalized to "not be free in"). Here we show special cases of ` A ` and ` ph ` that result in a contradiction if that requirement is not met. (Contributed by NM, 8-Feb-2006.)
blocks.origin:
thm notzfaus(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0) {
  |- wn(wex(s0, wal(s1, wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), w0)))))
  -| wceq(c0, csn(emptycls))
  -| wb(w0, wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  nex(s0, wal(s1, wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), w0))))
  mpbi(wn(wal(s1, wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), w0)))), wex(s1, wn(wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), w0)))))
  eximii(s1, wn(wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), w0))), wcel(cv(s1), c0))
  mpbi(wex(s1, wcel(cv(s1), c0)), wne(c0, emptycls))
  eqnetri(c0, emptycls, csn(emptycls))
  snnz(emptycls)
  0ex()
  n0(s1, c0)
  sylibr(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wn(wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), w0))), wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wn(wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), w0))))
  syl6bb(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wn(wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), w0)), wi(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  biimt(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))
  xchbinxr(wi(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), w0), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  iman(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))
  anbi2i(wcel(cv(s1), c0), w0, wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  xor3(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), w0))
  exnal(s1, wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), w0)))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm notzfaus(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0) {
  ⊢ ¬ ∃(s0, ∀(s1,(s1 ∈ s0 ↔(s1 ∈ c0 ∧ w0))))
  ⊣ c0 = { ∅ }
  ⊣ (w0 ↔ ¬ s1 ∈ s0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  nex(s0, ∀(s1,(s1 ∈ s0 ↔(s1 ∈ c0 ∧ w0))))
  mpbi(¬ ∀(s1,(s1 ∈ s0 ↔(s1 ∈ c0 ∧ w0))), ∃(s1, ¬(s1 ∈ s0 ↔(s1 ∈ c0 ∧ w0))))
  eximii(s1, ¬(s1 ∈ s0 ↔(s1 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)), s1 ∈ c0)
  mpbi(∃(s1, s1 ∈ c0), c0 ≠ ∅)
  eqnetri(c0, emptycls, { ∅ })
  snnz(emptycls)
  0ex()
  n0(s1, c0)
  sylibr(s1 ∈ c0, ¬(s1 ∈ s0 ↔(s1 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)), (s1 ∈ s0 ↔ ¬(s1 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)))
  syl6bb(s1 ∈ c0, s1 ∈ s0, ¬(s1 ∈ c0 ∧ w0), (s1 ∈ c0 → s1 ∈ s0))
  biimt(s1 ∈ c0, s1 ∈ s0)
  xchbinxr((s1 ∈ c0 → s1 ∈ s0), (s1 ∈ c0 ∧ w0), (s1 ∈ c0 ∧ ¬ s1 ∈ s0))
  iman(s1 ∈ c0, s1 ∈ s0)
  anbi2i(s1 ∈ c0, w0, ¬ s1 ∈ s0)
  xor3(s1 ∈ s0, (s1 ∈ c0 ∧ w0))
  exnal(s1, (s1 ∈ s0 ↔(s1 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)))
}

blocks.name: intv
blocks.content: The intersection of the universal class is empty. (Contributed by NM, 11-Sep-2008.)

blocks.name: axpweq
blocks.content: Two equivalent ways to express the Power Set Axiom. Note that ~ ax-pow is not used by the proof. When ~ ax-pow is assumed and ` A ` is a set, both sides of the biconditional hold. In ZF, both sides hold if and only if ` A ` is a set (see ~ pwexr ). (Contributed by NM, 22-Jun-2009.)
blocks.origin:
thm axpweq(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0) {
  |- wb(wcel(cpw(c0), universe), wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wal(s2, wi(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s2), c0))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
} = {
  bitri(wcel(cpw(c0), universe), wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wal(s2, wi(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s2), c0))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))), wex(s0, wcel(cpw(c0), cpw(cv(s0)))))
  impbii(wcel(cpw(c0), universe), wex(s0, wcel(cpw(c0), cpw(cv(s0)))))
  mpd(wcel(cpw(c0), universe), wex(s0, wcel(cpw(c0), cpw(cv(s0)))), wcel(cpw(c0), cpw(cpw(c0))))
  pwidg(cpw(c0), universe)
  spcegv(s0, cpw(c0), universe, wcel(cpw(c0), cpw(cpw(c0))), wcel(cpw(c0), cpw(cv(s0))))
  eleq2d(cpw(c0), cpw(cv(s0)), cpw(cpw(c0)), wceq(cv(s0), cpw(c0)))
  pweq(cv(s0), cpw(c0))
  exlimiv(s0, wcel(cpw(c0), cpw(cv(s0))), wcel(cpw(c0), universe))
  elex(cpw(c0), cpw(cv(s0)))
  exbii(s0, wcel(cpw(c0), cpw(cv(s0))), wal(s1, wi(wal(s2, wi(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s2), c0))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  bitri(wcel(cpw(c0), cpw(cv(s0))), wal(s1, wi(wal(s2, wi(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s2), c0))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wss(cpw(c0), cv(s0)))
  elpw2(cpw(c0), cv(s0))
  vex(s0)
  bitri(wss(cpw(c0), cv(s0)), wal(s1, wi(wal(s2, wi(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s2), c0))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wal(s1, wi(wss(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  pwss(s1, c0, cv(s0))
  albii(s1, wi(wss(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))), wi(wal(s2, wi(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s2), c0))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  imbi1i(wss(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wal(s2, wi(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s2), c0))))
  dfss2(s2, cv(s1), c0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cpw(c0), cpw(cpw(c0)))
  diff.cpw.s(s0, cpw(c0))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cpw(c0), universe)
  diff.cpw.s(s0, c0)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cv.s(s2, s1)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm axpweq(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0) {
  ⊢ (P(c0)∈ 𝕌 ↔ ∃(s0, ∀(s1,(∀(s2,(s2 ∈ s1 → s2 ∈ c0))→ s1 ∈ s0))))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
} = {
  bitri(P(c0)∈ 𝕌, ∃(s0, ∀(s1,(∀(s2,(s2 ∈ s1 → s2 ∈ c0))→ s1 ∈ s0))), ∃(s0, P(c0)∈ P(s0)))
  impbii(P(c0)∈ 𝕌, ∃(s0, P(c0)∈ P(s0)))
  mpd(P(c0)∈ 𝕌, ∃(s0, P(c0)∈ P(s0)), P(c0)∈ P(P(c0)))
  pwidg(P(c0), universe)
  spcegv(s0, P(c0), universe, P(c0)∈ P(P(c0)), P(c0)∈ P(s0))
  eleq2d(P(c0), P(s0), P(P(c0)), s0 = P(c0))
  pweq(s0, P(c0))
  exlimiv(s0, P(c0)∈ P(s0), P(c0)∈ 𝕌)
  elex(P(c0), P(s0))
  exbii(s0, P(c0)∈ P(s0), ∀(s1,(∀(s2,(s2 ∈ s1 → s2 ∈ c0))→ s1 ∈ s0)))
  bitri(P(c0)∈ P(s0), ∀(s1,(∀(s2,(s2 ∈ s1 → s2 ∈ c0))→ s1 ∈ s0)), P(c0)⊆ s0)
  elpw2(P(c0), s0)
  vex(s0)
  bitri(P(c0)⊆ s0, ∀(s1,(∀(s2,(s2 ∈ s1 → s2 ∈ c0))→ s1 ∈ s0)), ∀(s1,(s1 ⊆ c0 → s1 ∈ s0)))
  pwss(s1, c0, s0)
  albii(s1, (s1 ⊆ c0 → s1 ∈ s0), (∀(s2,(s2 ∈ s1 → s2 ∈ c0))→ s1 ∈ s0))
  imbi1i(s1 ⊆ c0, s1 ∈ s0, ∀(s2,(s2 ∈ s1 → s2 ∈ c0)))
  dfss2(s2, s1, c0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, P(c0), P(P(c0)))
  diff.cpw.s(s0, P(c0))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, P(c0), universe)
  diff.cpw.s(s0, c0)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cv.s(s2, s1)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
}
